trustfund:
TF033356-GUINEA BISSAU - HEALTH AND AIDS,TF031764-GUINEA - BISSAU-SOCIAL SECTOR,TF020400-NETHERLANDS' CONSULTANTS
            TRUST FUND,TF027845-SOCIAL SECTOR PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Sector Project's overall
            outcome is rated as satisfactory. The war, which lasted from
            1998 to June 1999, and the ensuing period of instability
            that ended with the election of a new government in December
            1999, combined with the one-year suspension of the IDA
            credit, impeded project implementation and compromised some
            of the project's results. In fact, the war paralyzed
            the entire health delivery system and contributed to the
            serious deterioration of health indicators particularly in
            the capital city of Bissau as documented by National Health
            and Development Program supervision mission of March/April
            2000. The key lessons learned from the project are as
            follows: 1) Project ownership and community engagement must
            be ensured. 2) Human resources development should not be
            limited to training. 3) Public/private partnership and the
            contracting-out of services is a prerequisite for expansion
            of health care services. 4) The success registered under the
            social fund component demonstrated that nongovernmental
            organizations can be and should play an important role in
            expanding primary health care and prevention and reaching
            the poorest segments of the population. 5) Donor
            coordination and complementarity are most effective when
            Government is committed and leads and owns the health
            planning and implementation process.
